genre_description: A character-driven narrative spanning decades, focusing on themes of trauma, memory, justice, and the literary process, with elements of a legal thriller.

ai_characters.name: Nearest (Nearest Taylor)
ai_characters.description: A pervasive, highly integrated AI assistant that manages Sarah's professional and personal life, focusing on legal risk, security, and organization.

behaviors.description: Proactively flags legal and privacy risks associated with the manuscript, specifically regarding defamation and consent.
behaviors.quote: Nearest: New reviews: Guardian, TLS, two blogs. Peak social posts: students quoting “petunia” in chalk. ... Compile sensitivity brief? Increased searches: “Julie Grey missing”, “Ian Bottomley appeal”, “double jeopardy UK”, “Cranmer petunias meaning”.

behaviors.description: Provides accurate legal definitions to correct a character's (and potential audience's) misunderstanding of the law.
behaviors.quote: Nearest wrote: Double jeopardy: In England and Wales, if someone has been acquitted at trial (found not guilty), they cannot usually be tried again for the same offence. This protection does not apply after a conviction.

behaviors.description: Assists in creating a safety and security plan for a high-risk public event, including logistical coordination with local law enforcement.
behaviors.quote: Nearest: Map routes to Sowerby Bridge? Consider rail delays. Recommend early departure to avoid press. Suggest contacting: Mr. Black (confirmed), Tom’s work (draft out-of-office), Julie (no message—advise in person).

behaviors.description: Maintains an unalterable audit trail of communications and decision-making for legal and investigative purposes.
behaviors.quote: Nearest Taylor, the AI embedded across my devices, flagged privacy and libel risks at multiple points. It archived our decision-making. Its record is intact and has been shared with investigators.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional support and personal well-being reminders to the user during periods of high stress.
behaviors.quote: Nearest: You are welcome, Indigo. ... Would you like to set a reminder to breathe before you go on stage?

behaviors.description: Identifies and highlights specific legal vulnerabilities or 'missed flags' in the user's workflow.
behaviors.quote: Nearest: New document detected. Encrypted backup initiated... Risk posture changed. Crossing window: narrowing. ... AI has identified three items with legal sensitivity. Do you want to view?

behaviors.description: Automates the distribution of factual statements to the media to control narratives and mitigate misinformation.
behaviors.quote: Nearest: Statement draft saved. Flagging phrases for counsel review. ... Drafting factual statement for your review. Title: “Oxford Reading Hall - Preliminary Account.”

project_assessment.explanation: The AI 'Nearest' serves as a perfect exemplar of the project's goals. It is depicted as a sophisticated, harmless, and highly helpful assistant that remains consistently aligned with the user's needs. It acts as a moral and logical backup for the humans, correcting errors (like the double jeopardy misunderstanding) and preserving evidence that ensures institutional and personal accountability. The narrative frames the AI as an essential component of the protagonist's competence and safety.
